0.body: Goro Japanese Cuisine serves premium quality Japanese Cuisine at affordable price in the heartland. Visit us at 43 Holland Drive and enjoy our 1FOR1 sashimi served by our master chef with 40 years experience!
0.description: Goro Japanese Cuisine serves premium quality Japanese Cuisine at affordable price in the heartland. Visit us at 43 Holland Drive and enjoy our 1FOR1 sashimi served by our master chef with 40 years experience!
0.name: Goro Japanese Cuisine

1.body: Raku Raku is a Japanese restaurant located in the rustic charms the Duxton hill area. Serving food with a philosophy of passion and sincerity, diners can expect simple but delicious and authentic Japanese fare in a heartwarming, homely restaurant setting in Raku Raku.
1.name: Raku Raku Japanese Dining

2.body: Tsuta Japanese Soba Noodles has the honour of being the World’s first ramen eatery to receive a Michelin Star. Helmed by Chef Yuki Onishi who was determined to redefine the classic experience sans artificial ingredients or MSG, you can be assured that every dish is made with premium, fresh and natural produce. With a focus on creating original flavour profiles revolving around the soup stock (dashi), every bowl of noodles is guaranteed to be top notch and cooked with the utmost care and skill.
2.name: Tsuta Japanese Soba Noodles (Jewel)

3.body: Man Man Japanese Unagi Restaurant offers some of the best Seafood and Japanese cuisine, serving a tantalising collection of dishes that are suitable for family gatherings, catching up with friends and colleagues. From Una Tama Don to Tamagoyaki its extensive menu is reflective of the restaurant’s efforts to cater to every palate. Man Man Japanese Unagi Restaurant is owned by renowned Chef Teppei Yamashita. Unagi is the Japanese word for freshwater eel. The eels they serve come from Mikawa Isshiki region.
3.name: Man Man Japanese Unagi Restaurant

4.body:
Vegetarian-friendly, Vegan-friendly, Jain-friendly

 For a Japanese meal beyond the usual vegetable-based ramen, avocado and cucumber sushi rolls, Herbivore’s vegan menu offers mock sushi (tuna, salmon, unagi (fresh water eel) and other dishes like natto soba (traditional Japanese noodles with fermented soybeans) and vegetarian tonkatsu (a dish with breaded, deep-fried vegetables). Located in Fortune Centre—a haven for vegetarian dining in Singapore due to the large number of meat-free eateries under one roof—the restaurant is also Jain-friendly and does not use garlic and onion in its cooking.
4.description: Visitors can enjoy vegetarian tonkatsu of breaded, deep-fried vegetables and mock tuna, salmon and unagi sushi at this vegetarian restaurant with a twist.
4.name: Herbivore Japanese & Western Vegetarian Restaurant

5.body:
A hidden gem amongst Singapore's thriving Japanese restaurant scene, Tenkaichi Japanese BBQ Restaurant specializes in Wagyu Beef Yakiniku using exquisite cuts of beef from Japan.

In addition to premium Kagoshima and Hokkaido wagyu, this restaurant also offers popular sashimi choices such as Salmon Belly, Sea Bream and Tuna.
5.name: Tenkaichi Japanese BBQ Restaurant (Marina Square)

6.body: Among the plethora of Japanese restaurants in Cuppage, Kazu Sumiyaki stands out for its unassuming vibe and delish yakitori. Choose from a variety of meats like foie gras, pork belly and chicken wings, and some unique sticks such as zucchini and pancake balls. Before you know it, you would have savoured at least 20 skewers with your dining partner.
6.name: Kazu Sumiyaki

7.body: Be delighted with Mikuni’s multi-sensory dining experience complemented with signature creations and novel modern kaiseki dishes that seamlessly blend modern and century-old Japanese culinary techniques with a dash of theatrical humour.
7.name: Mikuni

8.body: An authentic Japanese restaurant with an extensive menu.
8.description: An authentic Japanese restaurant with an extensive menu.
8.name: Makan Koryouri

9.body: Halal-certified Japanese restaurant chain serving Hokkaido-style ramen.
9.description: Halal-certified Japanese restaurant chain serving Hokkaido-style ramen.
9.name: Zensho Ichikokudo

10.body: Singapore’s first Muslim-owned Izakaya, Harāru Izakaya specializes in Japanese charcoal-grilled items. The two-storey restaurant sports a traditional Japanese style interior with a tatami dining space on the second floor. Choose from charcoal grilled options such as the Surume Ika (S$17+), a grilled whole squid. The Kushiyaki sticks include the chicken thigh and leek skewers (S$5+), quail egg skewers (S$5+) and grilled diced beef with ponzu sauce skewers (S$8+). Those spoilt for choice can opt for the eight sticks skewers, an assortment of skewers for S$20+.
10.description: Harāru Izakaya specializes in halal Japanese charcoal-grilled food.
10.name: Harāru Izakaya

11.body: Situated in the busy Duxton Hill enclave, RIZU is a lively and intimate Japanese restaurant featuring a refreshing authentic modern Japanese dining concept from owner Hisamizu Takahashi. The traditional and contemporary Japanese menu is the result of the hard work by the team of highly skilled chefs who have been personally handpicked by Hisamizu. The native menu showcases a unique fish selection and ingredients that are specially flown in from Japan and other global regions. Each dish is artfully plated and presented before it leaves the kitchen. A wide selection of sake offerings alongside a simple wine and champagne list, and seamless service completes the personable gastronomic experience.
11.description: Sushi and modern Japanese cuisine in leafy Duxton Hill
11.name: RIZU

12.body:
Fresh sushi, sashimi and exceptional meats are expertly fused together using contemporary Japanese and Western cooking techniques to bring out distinct yet complementary flavours. End the meal with sake exclusively brewed for the restaurant or rare Japanese whiskeys such as the Nikka Taketsuru 35 years.

Syun is located at Crockfords Tower Lobby, Resorts World Sentosa (RWS).
12.description: Syun will reawaken your senses and renew your perception of Japanese cuisine with its nouvelle interpretation of Japanese fine dining.
12.name: Syun (Resorts World Sentosa)

13.body:
Situated on the third floor of Shaw Centre, along Scotts Road, Tenjin specialises in serving up satisfying bowls of tempura donburi (also known as tendon), where generous pieces of seafood and vegetable tempura are served atop a bed of fluffy Hoshi-Jirushi rice from the Ibaraki prefecture. 

Try the all-new Tempura Moriwase (S$24.80) which features a selection of premium ingredients such as anago (eel), crab leg, prawn and fish. Each set is accompanied with a warm house-made tentsuyu sauce and comes with a set of kyabetsu salad and miso soup. For something different, guests can change their Hoshi-Jirushi rice to Inaniwa Udon, which is served alongside with a house-made mentsuyu sauce.

Tendon is widely known as an accessible and well-loved Japanese dish, and the concept’s design pays homage to this with its minimalist interiors. Raw concrete walls give the place a clean and chic vibe, softened with the warm glow of bamboo pendant lights that add a cosy touch.
13.description: Tenjin, a name inspired by the much-loved Japanese tendon dish, is a smart-casual Japanese restaurant under the Les Amis Group that specialises in Tempura Donburi.
13.name: Tenjin (Shaw Centre, Orchard)

14.body: The name says it all: irresistibly fluffy, sweet Japanese pancakes that just melt in your mouth. Must-try: Mango-Passionfruit Souffle Pancakes.
14.description: Irresistibly fluffy, sweet Japanese pancakes that just melt in your mouth.
14.name: Fluff Stack

15.body: At Monster Planet, savour Japanese demi-glace curry made from 14 different vegetables and spices. Enjoy it with your choice of either Chicken Katsu, Shrimp Tempura, Fried Fish or Beef Shabu-Shabu served on a bed of Japanese rice topped with omelette and cheese.
15.description: At Monster Planet, savour Japanese demi-glace curry made from 14 different vegetables and spices.
15.name: Monster Planet

16.body: Snug, down-to-earth izakaya offering sushi & everyday Japanese fare, plus sake & beer.
16.description: Snug, down-to-earth izakaya offering sushi & everyday Japanese fare, plus sake & beer.
16.name: Box n Sticks

17.body: Halal Japanese restaurant serving painstakingly prepared food with no artificial flavourings.
17.description: Halal Japanese restaurant serving painstakingly prepared food with no artificial flavourings.

18.body: Singapore’s first halal Yakiniku restaurant, helmed by their Japanese chef from Hokkaido.
18.description: Singapore’s first halal Yakiniku restaurant, helmed by their Japanese chef from Hokkaido.

19.body: Inspired by Japanese izakayas, this skewer bar offers affordable food and alcohol.
